column1: stakeholder;;[sound:word_stakeholder.mp3];[sound:meaning_stakeholder.mp3];[sound:example_stakeholder.mp3];A stakeholder is a person or group affected by a project or decision.;We shared the plan with every stakeholder before starting.;/ˈsteɪkˌhoʊldər/

roadmap;;[sound:word_roadmap.mp3];[sound:meaning_roadmap.mp3];[sound:example_roadmap.mp3];A roadmap is a plan that shows goals and steps over time.;The product roadmap lists features for the next six months.;/ˈroʊdˌmæp/

governance;;[sound:word_governance.mp3];[sound:meaning_governance.mp3];[sound:example_governance.mp3];Governance is how rules, roles, and decisions are managed in an organization.;Good governance makes responsibilities clear for everyone.;/ˈɡʌvərnəns/

compliance;;[sound:word_compliance.mp3];[sound:meaning_compliance.mp3];[sound:example_compliance.mp3];Compliance means following laws, rules, or standards.;The team updated the process to meet compliance requirements.;/kəmˈplaɪəns/

scalability;;[sound:word_scalability.mp3];[sound:meaning_scalability.mp3];[sound:example_scalability.mp3];Scalability is the ability to grow and handle more work without failing.;We improved scalability so the app can support more users.;/ˌskeɪləˈbɪləti/

interoperability;;[sound:word_interoperability.mp3];[sound:meaning_interoperability.mp3];[sound:example_interoperability.mp3];Interoperability is the ability of systems to work together and share data.;Interoperability helps different tools exchange information easily.;/ˌɪntərˌɑːpərəˈbɪləti/

architecture;;[sound:word_architecture.mp3];[sound:meaning_architecture.mp3];[sound:example_architecture.mp3];Architecture is the overall design of a system and how parts connect.;The new architecture separates data storage from processing.;/ˈɑːrkɪˌtɛktʃər/

orchestration;;[sound:word_orchestration.mp3];[sound:meaning_orchestration.mp3];[sound:example_orchestration.mp3];Orchestration is coordinating many tasks or services to work as one process.;Orchestration starts each service in the right order.;/ˌɔːrkəˈstreɪʃən/

observability;;[sound:word_observability.mp3];[sound:meaning_observability.mp3];[sound:example_observability.mp3];Observability is how well you can understand a system using logs, metrics, and traces.;Better observability helped us find the bug quickly.;/əbˌzɝːvəˈbɪləti/

resilience;;[sound:word_resilience.mp3];[sound:meaning_resilience.mp3];[sound:example_resilience.mp3];Resilience is the ability to recover after problems or failures.;Resilience keeps the service running during small outages.;/rɪˈzɪliəns/

redundancy;;[sound:word_redundancy.mp3];[sound:meaning_redundancy.mp3];[sound:example_redundancy.mp3];Redundancy means having extra parts so a system still works if something fails.;We added redundancy by using two servers instead of one.;/rɪˈdʌndənsi/

throughput;;[sound:word_throughput.mp3];[sound:meaning_throughput.mp3];[sound:example_throughput.mp3];Throughput is how much work a system can handle in a given time.;After the change, throughput increased during peak hours.;/ˈθruːˌpʊt/
latency;;[sound:word_latency.mp3];[sound:meaning_latency.mp3];[sound:example_latency.mp3];Latency is the delay between a request and the response.;High latency made the page feel slow.;/ˈleɪtənsi/

instrumentation;;[sound:word_instrumentation.mp3];[sound:meaning_instrumentation.mp3];[sound:example_instrumentation.mp3];Instrumentation is adding tools to measure how a system behaves.;Instrumentation lets us track errors and response times.;/ˌɪnstrəmenˈteɪʃən/

telemetry;;[sound:word_telemetry.mp3];[sound:meaning_telemetry.mp3];[sound:example_telemetry.mp3];Telemetry is data automatically collected from systems to monitor performance.;Telemetry showed a spike in memory use after the update.;/təˈlɛmɪtri/

benchmarking;;[sound:word_benchmarking.mp3];[sound:meaning_benchmarking.mp3];[sound:example_benchmarking.mp3];Benchmarking is testing performance and comparing results to a standard.;We used benchmarking to compare two database options.;/ˈbɛntʃˌmɑːrkɪŋ/

optimization;;[sound:word_optimization.mp3];[sound:meaning_optimization.mp3];[sound:example_optimization.mp3];Optimization is improving something to work faster, cheaper, or better.;Optimization reduced the time needed to process orders.;/ˌɑːptɪməˈzeɪʃən/

refactoring;;[sound:word_refactoring.mp3];[sound:meaning_refactoring.mp3];[sound:example_refactoring.mp3];Refactoring is changing code to make it cleaner without changing what it does.;Refactoring made the code easier to maintain.;/riːˈfæktərɪŋ/

deprecation;;[sound:word_deprecation.mp3];[sound:meaning_deprecation.mp3];[sound:example_deprecation.mp3];Deprecation is when a feature is still available but planned to be removed later.;We announced deprecation of the old API version.;/ˌdɛprəˈkeɪʃən/

migration;;[sound:word_migration.mp3];[sound:meaning_migration.mp3];[sound:example_migration.mp3];Migration is moving data, users, or systems from one place to another.;The migration to the new server finished overnight.;/maɪˈɡreɪʃən/

modernization;;[sound:word_modernization.mp3];[sound:meaning_modernization.mp3];[sound:example_modernization.mp3];Modernization is updating systems or processes to use newer methods and tools.;Modernization helped us replace old software safely.;/ˌmɑːdərnəˈzeɪʃən/

containerization;;[sound:word_containerization.mp3];[sound:meaning_containerization.mp3];[sound:example_containerization.mp3];Containerization packages an app with its needs so it runs the same everywhere.;Containerization made deployment faster and more consistent.;/kənˌteɪnərɪˈzeɪʃən/

virtualization;;[sound:word_virtualization.mp3];[sound:meaning_virtualization.mp3];[sound:example_virtualization.mp3];Virtualization is running virtual machines on a physical computer.;Virtualization let us run several servers on one machine.;/ˌvɝːtʃuələˈzeɪʃən/

provisioning;;[sound:word_provisioning.mp3];[sound:meaning_provisioning.mp3];[sound:example_provisioning.mp3];Provisioning is setting up resources like servers, accounts, or access.;Provisioning a new environment takes only a few minutes now.;/prəˈvɪʒənɪŋ/

automation;;[sound:word_automation.mp3];[sound:meaning_automation.mp3];[sound:example_automation.mp3];Automation uses tools to do tasks with little human effort.;Automation sends reports every morning automatically.;/ˌɔːtəˈmeɪʃən/

integration;;[sound:word_integration.mp3];[sound:meaning_integration.mp3];[sound:example_integration.mp3];Integration is connecting systems so they work together.;The integration with payments reduced manual work.;/ˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃən/

consolidation;;[sound:word_consolidation.mp3];[sound:meaning_consolidation.mp3];[sound:example_consolidation.mp3];Consolidation is combining things into one to simplify management.;Consolidation reduced costs by merging two platforms.;/kənˌsɑːlɪˈdeɪʃən/

standardization;;[sound:word_standardization.mp3];[sound:meaning_standardization.mp3];[sound:example_standardization.mp3];Standardization means using the same rules or methods across a group.;Standardization made training easier for new employees.;/ˌstændərdɪˈzeɪʃən/

harmonization;;[sound:word_harmonization.mp3];[sound:meaning_harmonization.mp3];[sound:example_harmonization.mp3];Harmonization is making different policies or systems work well together.;Harmonization aligned our teams on one set of terms.;/ˌhɑːrmənəˈzeɪʃən/

segmentation;;[sound:word_segmentation.mp3];[sound:meaning_segmentation.mp3];[sound:example_segmentation.mp3];Segmentation is dividing users or markets into groups with similar needs.;Segmentation helped us target messages to each group.;/ˌsɛɡmənˈteɪʃən/

personalization;;[sound:word_personalization.mp3];[sound:meaning_personalization.mp3];[sound:example_personalization.mp3];Personalization is adapting content or services to an individual user.;Personalization shows products based on your interests.;/ˌpɝːsənələˈzeɪʃən/

monetization;;[sound:word_monetization.mp3];[sound:meaning_monetization.mp3];[sound:example_monetization.mp3];Monetization is turning a product or service into a source of income.;Monetization improved after we launched a paid plan.;/ˌmʌnətaɪˈzeɪʃən/

profitability;;[sound:word_profitability.mp3];[sound:meaning_profitability.mp3];[sound:example_profitability.mp3];Profitability is the ability to make more money than you spend.;Profitability increased when costs went down.;/ˌprɑːfɪtəˈbɪləti/

forecasting;;[sound:word_forecasting.mp3];[sound:meaning_forecasting.mp3];[sound:example_forecasting.mp3];Forecasting is predicting future results using current and past data.;Forecasting suggests sales will rise next quarter.;/ˈfɔːrˌkæstɪŋ/

valuation;;[sound:word_valuation.mp3];[sound:meaning_valuation.mp3];[sound:example_valuation.mp3];Valuation is estimating how much something is worth.;The startup’s valuation grew after the new investment.;/ˌvæljuˈeɪʃən/

liquidity;;[sound:word_liquidity.mp3];[sound:meaning_liquidity.mp3];[sound:example_liquidity.mp3];Liquidity is how easily assets can be turned into cash.;We kept extra cash to improve liquidity.;/lɪˈkwɪdəti/

solvency;;[sound:word_solvency.mp3];[sound:meaning_solvency.mp3];[sound:example_solvency.mp3];Solvency is the ability to pay long-term debts and stay financially stable.;Strong cash flow supports solvency during hard times.;/ˈsɑːlvənsi/

amortization;;[sound:word_amortization.mp3];[sound:meaning_amortization.mp3];[sound:example_amortization.mp3];Amortization is paying off a loan in regular payments over time.;The schedule shows amortization for the next five years.;/əˌmɔːrtɪˈzeɪʃən/

capitalization;;[sound:word_capitalization.mp3];[sound:meaning_capitalization.mp3];[sound:example_capitalization.mp3];Capitalization is the total value of a company or the act of funding it.;The company’s market capitalization rose after strong earnings.;/ˌkæpɪtələˈzeɪʃən/

arbitrage;;[sound:word_arbitrage.mp3];[sound:meaning_arbitrage.mp3];[sound:example_arbitrage.mp3];Arbitrage is making profit from price differences in different markets.;Traders used arbitrage when the same asset had two prices.;/ˈɑːrbɪtrɑːʒ/

procurement;;[sound:word_procurement.mp3];[sound:meaning_procurement.mp3];[sound:example_procurement.mp3];Procurement is the process of buying goods or services for a business.;Procurement negotiated better prices with suppliers.;/prəˈkjʊrmənt/

outsourcing;;[sound:word_outsourcing.mp3];[sound:meaning_outsourcing.mp3];[sound:example_outsourcing.mp3];Outsourcing is paying an outside company to do certain work.;We used outsourcing for customer support during weekends.;/ˈaʊtˌsɔːrsɪŋ/

partnership;;[sound:word_partnership.mp3];[sound:meaning_partnership.mp3];[sound:example_partnership.mp3];A partnership is a relationship where two sides work together for shared goals.;The partnership with the vendor improved delivery times.;/ˈpɑːrtnərʃɪp/

collaboration;;[sound:word_collaboration.mp3];[sound:meaning_collaboration.mp3];[sound:example_collaboration.mp3];Collaboration is working together to achieve a result.;Collaboration between teams reduced duplicate work.;/kəˌlæbəˈreɪʃən/

negotiation;;[sound:word_negotiation.mp3];[sound:meaning_negotiation.mp3];[sound:example_negotiation.mp3];Negotiation is discussing to reach an agreement.;After negotiation, both sides accepted the new contract.;/nɪˌɡoʊʃiˈeɪʃən/

confidentiality;;[sound:word_confidentiality.mp3];[sound:meaning_confidentiality.mp3];[sound:example_confidentiality.mp3];Confidentiality means keeping information private and not sharing it.;Employees signed a policy on confidentiality.;/ˌkɑːnfɪˌdɛnʃiˈælɪti/

accountability;;[sound:word_accountability.mp3];[sound:meaning_accountability.mp3];[sound:example_accountability.mp3];Accountability means being responsible for actions and results.;Accountability improved when owners were assigned to each task.;/əˌkaʊntəˈbɪləti/

auditability;;[sound:word_auditability.mp3];[sound:meaning_auditability.mp3];[sound:example_auditability.mp3];Auditability is how easily actions can be checked and verified later.;We improved auditability by keeping clear change logs.;/ˌɔːdɪtəˈbɪləti/

attribution;;[sound:word_attribution.mp3];[sound:meaning_attribution.mp3];[sound:example_attribution.mp3];Attribution is identifying who caused or created a result.;Attribution showed which campaign brought the new users.;/ˌætrɪˈbjuːʃən/

differentiation;;[sound:word_differentiation.mp3];[sound:meaning_differentiation.mp3];[sound:example_differentiation.mp3];Differentiation is making something stand out from others.;Our main differentiation is faster support and simpler pricing.;/ˌdɪfəˌrɛnʃiˈeɪʃən/
